We located the report Perez was talking about. In this table, BLS
summarizes median weekly earnings of full-time wage and salary workers in
2012 and 2013 by whether they are in a union or not.
The table shows that the median weekly earnings for union members in 2013
was $950, compared to $750 for non-union workers.
So Perez is basically right, with one exception. He should have referred
to median earnings, rather than average earnings. A median takes the exact
middle value from a list that’s ordered from biggest to smallest, rather
than taking the sum of all earnings and dividing it by the number of
people. The two calculations usually aren’t the same; a median is less
likely to be skewed by very small or very large values.

which make Perez’s claim less accurate.
